text:
hey <!here|@here>,

was good to get everyone in the room together yesterda.  know that the relative silence on my side thus far is attributable to the scope, and thus timeline being somewhat of a moving target still.  here are some updates on my side and know that i’m hoping we sparked a dialog yesterday.  let me know of any/all questions or ideas that you have!
	•	I had time booked with Dimitry and Leia to catch em up today and start setting a plan for getting rest of team access however, *we have client in house today and a bunch of meetings have to move as a result*
	•	We have a project folder!  Its set up same way as Care 3.0 for ease of use.  <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0Bx4AgyarifjlZnJLUGdyUVJycHc>
	•	Within it, feel free to check out:
	⁃	Client’s wires that illustrate the idea of chatbot: <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2hvp3pmOYCFUFBES1BUUU5xZDg>
	⁃	Pre-Production docs <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2hvp3pmOYCFdFQzbDVvNlVzOEk>
	⁃	Some research done for 3.0 team <https://drive.google.com/open?id=0Bx4AgyarifjlR01fS1FIR1dvLWs>
	•	We have a Harvest project set up.  Everyone should have access
	•	We’re meeting with copywriters (met three yesterday and 2 more tomorrow) 
	•	Finally as a result of _all the things_ we’re experiencing some scheduling shifts and thus the Semio session and immediate next steps will likely push out a few days.  
	•	We’re still on though and when we GO, we hit the ground RUNNING

oh and speaking of Semio session, wondering what you can do to prep?  Well, look above AND I'd reccomend reading about bots...chat bots.  There's tons of talks and articles out there right now.  Here's a good one to start with: <http://marketingland.com/inside-chatbots-year-growing-pains-210182>

attachments.title: Inside chatbots’ year of growing pains: 'We’re at an inflection point'
attachments.text: Marketing Land is a daily, must-read site for CMOs, digital marketing executives and advertising campaign managers.
attachments.fallback: Marketing Land: Inside chatbots’ year of growing pains: 'We’re at an inflection point'

text: And if anyone is interested in a spreadsheet comparing different APIs please see this: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1x3WdPRPv8aJj9QveF7sgo4R3kBOOCMsyPTKVqXkgnIU/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0K8ZSHN0|lee> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/lee/F4UB0UN3U/2017|Voice API Comparisons - 3/2017>
Ignore that is says Voice
This is just what we have researched so far, there are new ones popping up everyday
rad, thanks lee.  I made a copy and placed in our Research folder
<https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2hvp3pmOYCFT3NMM0dyd0R1NlU>
We should be careful not to deliver anything from another project to Care. We can reference and leverage, but let’s keep this document itself internal
I've actually already sent that to care with Evans expressed permission
It was scrubbed of adidas refs, etc
(in our very early response)
yup! all good
Sorry, should have clarified, it was a total rewrite just for Care
<@U2670DYLE|johncohoon> has joined the channel
none of the previous info was still true
ah awesome
thanks <@U0K8ZSHN0>
<@U167FL70V|leia> has joined the channel
seeing some people join here, sorry if not everyone was in the room at onset, moving quickly on lots of things
no worries :slightly_smiling_face:
added you to drive leia
thank you!

Another article: <http://mashable.com/2017/04/04/equal-pay-chatbot-facebook/#dsFlH8f9miqK>

My thoughts: It’s interesting how they acknowledged that this is a bot, not the real inspiration but that it’s meant to mimic the real person.  A clever way of expectation-setting.  
Seems like a pretty simple execution where it collects specific data, markov chain output.

attachments.title: Equal pay chatbot wants to help women 'make a sh*t ton of money'
attachments.text: You ready to get the money you deserve?
attachments.fallback: Mashable: Equal pay chatbot wants to help women 'make a sh*t ton of money'

text: h/t J strand

Also, just added to our research folder.  <http://Care.com|Care.com> team had a convo with some product folks at Facebook Messenger (regarded as the leading platform in terms of adoption).  Check out these raw notes. They're confidential and for onboarding purposes only.  <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/document/d/12MsW_3fMHzbqtlzzXGLAE6aKchAQgrk8v-vWGIrCz5s/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0ML49XU0|dennishanley> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/dennishanley/F4UER6YS0/chat_with_facebook_pm..|Chat with Facebook PM...Care Insights>

hey team,

sorry for late slack. no need for action just fyi at this point. i’ve caught up with some of ya but after a couple of days in meetings want to share out with the group the latest in where we’re netting out. 

we're looking at a *shift in scope that’s currently netting out without a need for active development.*  
that’s not to say june 22nd is off the table but it’s likely the client would do the development in house.

that said, new scope looks like: 
- Strategy for Asst / Bridge to Care 3.0
- Advised Prioritization of Phase 1 Features/Scenarios
- Visual Style Guide, applied to scenario as example
- Brand Voice Style Guide, applied to scenario as example
- UX Best Practices, applied to scenario as example

and team would drop down to design, ux, production and one to two developers, part time,  to still learn the platform, advise our team on what’s possible and interface directly with the care tech team. 

i don’t wanna expose you all to too much thrash but keep you looped in. the good news is *client is excited and remains on same page as us*. for now i’d recommend still familiarizing yourself with the project and participating in friday (time tbd) sego session. from there, depending on scope, we may be scope down the project team as mentioned above.

ok, thats the end of that slack novel :slightly_smiling_face: as always, here for you if you have questions, concerns or ideas.
